info.author: UNKNOWN
info.description:
Product Tagger
================

Introduction
------------

The package aims at findng core terms, brand, and descriptions from a product title from e-commerce websites.


> Example: product title: 'Makibes Unisex Red LED Digital Band Wrist Watch')

      product core term:  'watch'
      product brand name: 'makibes'
      Descriptions: 'unisex red led digital band wrist'


Usage
-----

    $ python
    >>> from product_tagger import tag_product
    >>> tag_product('Makibes Unisex Red LED Digital Band Wrist Watch')
    (u'watch', u'makibes', u'unisex red led digital band wrist')

The tagger can also be called in a shell

    $ cd product_tagger
    $ python product_tagger.py 'Makibes Unisex Red LED Digital Band Wrist Watch'
    ===========
    ('Core term: ', u'watch')
    ('Brand: ', u'makibes')
    ('Discriptions: ', u'unisex red led digital band wrist')

Requirements
------------

-   Python >=2.7 or >=3.3
-   nltk >=3.2.1
-   requests >= 2.8.1
-   lxml
-   xlrd
info.name: product_tagger
info.html_description:
Introduction

The package aims at findng core terms, brand, and descriptions from a product title from e-commerce websites.

> Example: product title: ‘Makibes Unisex Red LED Digital Band Wrist Watch’)

product core term: ‘watch’ product brand name: ‘makibes’ Descriptions: ‘unisex red led digital band wrist’

Usage

$ python >>> from product_tagger import tag_product >>> tag_product(‘Makibes Unisex Red LED Digital Band Wrist Watch’) (u’watch’, u’makibes’, u’unisex red led digital band wrist’)

The tagger can also be called in a shell

$ cd product_tagger $ python product_tagger.py ‘Makibes Unisex Red LED Digital Band Wrist Watch’ =========== (‘Core term: ‘, u’watch’) (‘Brand: ‘, u’makibes’) (‘Discriptions: ‘, u’unisex red led digital band wrist’)

Requirements

  • Python >=2.7 or >=3.3
  • nltk >=3.2.1
  • requests >= 2.8.1
  • lxml
  • xlrd
